mapper.sql: ID, TITLE, URL, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER, UPTADE_TIME, UPDATE_USER
mapper.insert: insert into policyfile (ID, TITLE, URL, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER, UPTADE_TIME, UPDATE_USER) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{url,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{uptadeTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR})

ID,
TITLE,
URL,
CREATE_TIME,
CREATE_USER,
UPTADE_TIME,
UPDATE_USER,

mapper.update:
update policyfile
TITLE = #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
URL = #{url,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
CREATE_TIME = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
CREATE_USER = #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
UPTADE_TIME = #{uptadeTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
UPDATE_USER = #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update policyfile set TITLE = #{title,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, URL = #{url,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CREATE_TIME = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, CREATE_USER = #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, UPTADE_TIME = #{uptadeTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, UPDATE_USER = #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where ID = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select count(*) from policyfile where TITLE LIKE #{param}
